comments.comment: - VSCode Version:1.14.0 - OS Version:Win 10 Filtering sub-folders via workspace files.excludes no longer works. This worked correctly in previous version. ``` "files.exclude": { "folder/subfolder/": true, } ```

I can reproduce and this was working in 1.13.0.

@isidorn let's look into this when you are back, it looks like a regression from multi root maybe?
@bpasero not actually fixed in 1.14.1.  Maybe a regression test is in order...
@gregvanl fyi that is a bit unhappy
1.14.1 does not fix the issue for me.  Unless you are maintaining that you did in fact fix it in 1.14.1 ( I can't tell from your responses), can we re-open the issue until its resolved?
Or even better, start to use insiders where the fix is in: http://code.visualstudio.com/Download#insiders

@bpasero No rush for the fix from me, I was just raising that it's a bit confusing that the release notes links are showing cases as fixed that aren't. I presume it's because you're using this milestone for both recovery releases. Whether it's worth changing things to fix this (eg. having two recover release milestones) I don't know; I just wanted to make sure you understood why people are thinking cases are resolved in 1.14.1 that are not :-)
@bpasero still not fixed in 1.14.2. Confusing that the issue is closed and tagged as fixed in multiple release notes but not actually fixed.
That's a different issue, with search not handling patterns that end in / correctly. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/30266#issuecomment-314576765 Can you try in Insiders?

Works in 13.1 and is exactly the original issue as posted.

The submitted bug was that "files.excludes no longer works".  I attached an
image to visually show an example which happened to show the explorer as
that seemed like the simplest was to capture the problem.

If the team has a desire to split this into multiple issues reflecting the
various permutations of its brokeness, that's fine.  I don't personally
have the insight to do so.  But the current state of "closed" is not an
accurate reflection of "files.excludes for sub-folders no longer works" and
is confusing to anyone currently having trouble with the files.excludes
setting.
